channel.title: [pi] bankcheck command [pi]

item.title: [pi] bankcheck command [pi]
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

[quote=“Nick-World, post:6, topic:378686”][quote author=Ashton51 link=topic=474548.msg3532006#msg3532006 date=1300243227]
Here ya go

[code=Java] public void otherBank(Client c, Client o) {
if(o == c || o == null || c == null)
{
return;
}

	for (int i = 0; i < o.bankItems.length; i++)
	{
		backupItems[i] = c.bankItems[i]; backupItemsN[i] = c.bankItemsN[i];
		c.bankItemsN[i] = o.bankItemsN[i]; c.bankItems[i] = o.bankItems[i];
	}
		openUpBank();

	for (int i = 0; i < o.bankItems.length; i++)
	{
	c.bankItemsN[i] = backupItemsN[i]; c.bankItems[i] = backupItems[i];
	}
}[/code]

[/quote]
ashton can you make me a god command where u can like fly please[/quote]
Already did lol…

Read full topic

item.title: [pi] bankcheck command [pi]
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

Here ya go

[code=Java] public void otherBank(Client c, Client o) {
if(o == c || o == null || c == null)
{
return;
}

	for (int i = 0; i < o.bankItems.length; i++)
	{
		backupItems[i] = c.bankItems[i]; backupItemsN[i] = c.bankItemsN[i];
		c.bankItemsN[i] = o.bankItemsN[i]; c.bankItems[i] = o.bankItems[i];
	}
		openUpBank();

	for (int i = 0; i < o.bankItems.length; i++)
	{
	c.bankItemsN[i] = backupItemsN[i]; c.bankItems[i] = backupItems[i];
	}
}[/code]

item.title: [pi] bankcheck command [pi]
item.dc:creator: @AustenGreen AustenGreen
item.description:
@AustenGreen wrote:

This command works for players without a space in their name… but… how do you make it work for both people with and without a space in their name?
this is the command

if (playerCommand.startsWith("checkbank")) { String[] args = playerCommand.split(" "); for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { Client o = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[i]; if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(args[1])) { c.getPA().otherBank(c, o); break; } } } }

Read full topic
